entries.meaning: (nautical) A boat especially designed for saving the lives of shipwrecked people or people in distress at sea (either launched from the shore with a crew, or else carried on board a larger ship).
examples: I've got a watch that turns into a lifeboat

entries.meaning: (science fiction) An emergency vehicle carried aboard a spaceship.

verbs.description: lifeboat (third-person singular simple present lifeboats, present participle lifeboating, simple past and past participle lifeboated)

entries.meaning: To rescue; to carry to safety
